reviews.review_msg: He's a nice guy but unless you like taking about a 1000 pages worth of notes and being tested on micro details, this is not the guy for you
Worst professor in the Political Science department at SFU!

Yeah, the lectures were kind of disorganized. A heavy reading load was assigned. She did, however, personally mark the essays and exams for a class of over 70 students and provide plenty of feedback (at least on the first paper). I do agree that what we were expected to have learned at the end of the course was not clear.

Linda is disorganized. The subject material isn't placed in a coherent manner. It felt like I received a superficial understanding of International Organizations and IR...I wish there was a textbook. Also, Linda objectives are not clear. By the time the final roles around, it is still unclear what she expects us to know and understand.

It really surprises me to see so many rate her as easy. That is not my impression at all. On the contrary. For each of my assignments, some of her criticisms have been unfair and her marking surprisingly hard. I also found her lectures to be dry and really not as interesting as I had hoped from this class.

You need to attend class and take good notes - they can save a lot of time on the take home midterm and final.  Good lectures, though a bit disorganized.  She improved throughout the term.  She really emphasizes developing a good general knowledge.  Provides a great suggested reading list, I used it for research papers for my other classes.

I ended up teaching my self. She is an awesome person and really smart. But super dis organized, all over the place. It is her first year teaching so i cut her some slack. But don't go into the class expecting to learn a lot! She hardly used the material and her notes in class are horrible, chicken scratch! I gave  up on taking notes!

Brand new prof.  Really nice and caring.  My only complaint was we had too much reading (5 articles 40 pages each per week) and 80% of the readings were never discussed at all.  Doesn't reply to emails and seldom available because of her demanding research schedule.  Not really her fault.  I enjoyed the class
james was a caring prof. the lectures were long but he was always willing to help his students.

Horrible prof. Takes forever to reply to his email, forever to mark our assignments and doesn't even give it back to us. His instructions are so ambiguous and he does not want to help his student in any way. I suggest to avoid him because online is already hard and he does not make it any easier..

Avoid him. Did all his assignments and received 0 back even after the final, still nothing. I've heard he is a hard marker which I guess is true but again how would I know if he does not hand back our assignment on time?!!?!? You will learn nothing in this class and you won't even get a good mark so just avoid him!

The course content is very dry, and James did his best in teaching it. The course is also more IR than poli sci, so be aware of that. Three papers in total, plus weekly discussion on Canvas. His marking criteria for the papers wasn't very clear and he is extremely slow in marking - we got our midterm paper grade after classes had ended!

Crystal clear; so much that by merely regurgitating what he said in lecture, you will NOT do well on the exam.  You must understand his ideas and then engage them intelligently, and by requiring this, James makes you think for yourself.  You WILL learn a lot from him; he is demanding, and because of this, you will come away from his class smarter.

by far the best course i've ever taken, and the best prof i've ever had. lectures were extremely loaded with info, but not presented in such a way that it was overwhelming. term paper was heavy (15 pages) but topics were appropriate to the length. take-home final, which was easy.

A very charming fellow. He gives lectures with a passion and intensity that really makes attending enjoyable. He also tries to get the class involved as much as possible, and never talks down to us- a welcome change! I must say though, the class I took was agonizingly long. Even his charms start to wear off after three hours.
super smart
WOW. So smart. A lot of readings, but also a lot to say. Take this course.
Challenging, but my favorite POL class yet. Awesome lectures.
Simply the best
Good prof - kept me up at 9AM! Demands lots but knows his stuff
This guy gives you the goods.You'd better be ready to carry the load.
Very high standards with lots of reading.  Very clear and helpful though.
